Quartermaster.synopsis: Dialog with the Flaming Fist Quartermaster, an experienced woman frustrated at the new steel watch unit placed in her armoury.You need to convince her to allow you to trade with her.

MessHallCook.synopsis: Dialog with the cook in Wyrm Rock. One liner.

MessHallBodyguard_005_0.speaker: Lord Jannath's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_005_0.text: Hush - the patriars are upstairs. Lord Jannath could call for me at any moment.

MessHallBodyguard_002_0.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_002_0.text: Hells' hallows - the ceremony's gone on for days, seems like.

MessHallBodyguard_002_1.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_002_1.text: Still upstairs, are they? Should have figured.

AudienceHallGuard_004_0.speaker: Fist Quickstitch
AudienceHallGuard_004_0.text: Lord Gortash, dead! Gods, I'm heartbroken. But a Flaming Fist doesn't weep.

AudienceHallGuard_004_1.speaker: Fist Quickstitch
AudienceHallGuard_004_1.text: Big day, big day - can hardly contain myself!

AudienceHallGuard_004_2.speaker: Fist Quickstitch
AudienceHallGuard_004_2.text: No Watch? No worries. Gortash'll let nothing stand in his way.

AudienceHallGuard_004_3.speaker: Fist Quickstitch
AudienceHallGuard_004_3.text: Would it be rude to ask the Archduke for an autograph? Of course it would - why am I even asking?

AudienceHallGuard_004_4.speaker: Fist Quickstitch
AudienceHallGuard_004_4.text: He did it - he's really Archduke. So excited I could jump right out of my boots!

AudienceHallGuard_004_5.speaker: Fist Quickstitch
AudienceHallGuard_004_5.text: Gortash said 'hello' to me once. That commanding voice of his, made my heart thump!

SouthBridgeGuard_001_40.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_40.text: Sorry, chum, can't let you through. Wyrm's Rock's closed for the day.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_46.speaker: Wyll
SouthBridgeGuard_001_46.text: Not closed to Duke Ulder Ravengard's own son, surely?

SouthBridgeGuard_001_68.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_68.text: You having a laugh, devil-boy? I know Ravengard - and last I knew, his spawn wasn't sporting those horns.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_11.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_11.text: The joke's on you. No entry - that's the end of it.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_24.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_24.text: See this? I've been invited to the ordination.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_63.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_63.text: I'll be - you don't look the posh sort. Last door on the right. Go on, make merry.
SouthBridgeGuard_001_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: The guard tilts her head as if reading your documents. No reason to show the documents.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_9.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_9.text: As you can see, I have an urgent dispatch for Duke Ravengard.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_77.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_77.text: Looks in order. Last door on the right. Don't keep the Duke waiting.
SouthBridgeGuard_001_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The guard tilts her head as if reading your documents. No reason to show the documents.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_22.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_22.text: What's so special about this occasion?

SouthBridgeGuard_001_69.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_69.text: Ordination is what. Lord Gortash is becoming Archduke. All the peers came to pay regards.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_17.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_17.text: Baldur's Gate is my home. I don't need permission to enter.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_7.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_7.text: This is ridiculous. I already got permission to enter.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_23.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_23.text: Special occasion. Wyrm's Rock is closed - invited guests only.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_64.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_64.text: Investigator Valeria needs me in the Lower City - a serial killer's on the loose.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_29.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_29.text: Valeria? Well I'm not messing about with a murder inquiry, for damn sure.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_67.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_67.text: Straight ahead, across the bridge. A blind ogre couldn't miss it.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_75.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_75.text: Provide the pass you took from Valeria.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_70.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_70.text: Not closed to Duke Ulder Ravengard's own son, surely?

SouthBridgeGuard_001_1.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_1.text: Wyll Ravengard? Lord Gortash said you might be stumbling this way.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_76.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_76.text: Not closed to Duke Ulder Ravengard's own son, surely?

SouthBridgeGuard_001_55.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_55.text: An assassin is in pursuit of Duke Ravengard. I need to warn him!

SouthBridgeGuard_001_10.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_10.text: Hells - first Stelmane, and now this. Hurry up, then - last door on the right.
SouthBridgeGuard_001_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The guard tilts her head as if reading your documents. No reason to show the documents.NodeContext: Bored

SouthBridgeGuard_001_28.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_28.text: Bah - the place is near to bursting with guards. The duke's safer than a snail in a steel shell.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_58.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_58.text: Bah - the place is crawling with Watchers. The duke's safer than a snail in a steel shell.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_44.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_44.text: I'm here to protect Archduke-Elect Gortash.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_16.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_16.text: How many bodyguards does the man need? Get on, then - last door on the right.
SouthBridgeGuard_001_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The guard tilts her head as if reading your documents. No reason to show the documents.NodeContext: Bored

SouthBridgeGuard_001_42.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_42.text: Gortash's got all the protection he needs. A cultist makes so much as a peep, the Fist'll turn them to cinder.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_27.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_27.text: Gortash's got all the protection he needs. A cultist makes so much as a peep, the Watch'll turn them to cinder.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_26.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_26.text: Such a bother. What if I were to contribute to the 'Flaming Fist Orphans' Fund'?

SouthBridgeGuard_001_38.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_38.text: Ah yes, the 'Orphans' Fund'. You can pay me directly - I'll make sure to pass your gold to the 'orphans'. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

SouthBridgeGuard_001_43.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_43.text: I'll see that the 'orphans' put your donation to good use.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_12.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns away from the player and calls out to unseen gatekeeper off-screenNodeContext: turns away from the player and calls out to unseen gatekeeper off-screen

SouthBridgeGuard_001_74.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_74.text: Please let me in - I'm meant to be in the coronation orchestra, it's my big break!

SouthBridgeGuard_001_15.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_15.text: Workshy minstrels, I swear to Helm - Whatever. I'm not getting it in the neck because some flautist was missing.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_37.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_37.text: You want the last door on the right. Hop to it, bard - you're late enough as is.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_65.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_65.text: It's not my job to coddle workshy, disorganised minstrels. It's your job to turn up on time with everyone else. Sod off.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_41.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_41.text: I am Lord Gortash's new occultist - let me pass or your name goes in the Book of Vile Darkness.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_3.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_3.text: Don't know what he needs you for when he's got those bloody great Steel Watchers.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_13.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_13.text: But... unprecedented times and all that. Head through - you want the last door on your right.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_51.speaker: Blaze Elin
SouthBridgeGuard_001_51.text: I'll shove your book somewhere vile and dark if you don't stop wasting my time.

SouthBridgeGuard_001_71.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeGuard_001_71.text: What if I were to contribute to the 'Flaming Fist Orphans' Fund'? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

AudienceHallGuard_006_0.speaker: Fist Fernhollow
AudienceHallGuard_006_0.text: Don't like the look of this Gortash fellow. But don't you tell him I said that.

AudienceHallGuard_006_1.speaker: Fist Fernhollow
AudienceHallGuard_006_1.text: If Gortash is so mighty, how'd he let those Watchers get shut down? Hmm? HMM?

AudienceHallGuard_006_2.speaker: Fist Fernhollow
AudienceHallGuard_006_2.text: Don't like the look of that Gortash. He's got nice hair. Only troublemakers got hair like that.

AudienceHallGuard_006_3.speaker: Fist Fernhollow
AudienceHallGuard_006_3.text: How'd Gortash get to be Archduke, anyway? I didn't vote for him.

AudienceHallGuard_006_4.speaker: Fist Fernhollow
AudienceHallGuard_006_4.text: See there? Beady eyes. Gortash is no good, no matter what Ravengard says.

AudienceHallGuard_006_5.speaker: Fist Fernhollow
AudienceHallGuard_006_5.text: Heh. 'Lord' Gortash didn't last long, did he? How a bunch of tough old veterans got fooled by that pipsqueak I'll never understand.

FFOfficeGuard_002_0.speaker: Fist Broko
FFOfficeGuard_002_0.text: 'Archduke Gortash', eh? The city's headed in the right direction.

FFOfficeGuard_002_1.speaker: Fist Broko
FFOfficeGuard_002_1.text: Keep your voice down - we're in mourning for Lord Gortash. I need to go put on a black armband.

FFOfficeGuard_002_2.speaker: Fist Broko
FFOfficeGuard_002_2.text: Keep your voice down. Ceremony upstairs - they're swearing in the new Archduke.

FFOfficeGuard_002_3.speaker: Fist Broko
FFOfficeGuard_002_3.text: The city's first Archduke. Bet the patriars will fall right in line.

BarracksGuard_003_2.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_2.text: When that army comes, I'll be ready. I promise.

BarracksGuard_003_8.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_8.text: Wh - oh. What do you - what are you doing in here?

BarracksGuard_003_107.speaker: Narrator
BarracksGuard_003_107.text: *You notice the gnome slip a lockpick into his pocket.*

BarracksGuard_003_33.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_33.text: You're not a Fist. Go on, get out, or - or I'll wake the others!
BarracksGuard_003_33.context: InternalNodeContext: Panicking and whispering, trying to avoid waking up his comradesNodeContext: realisation, turning to bluffing - he doesn't want to wake them

BarracksGuard_003_9.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_9.text: Go ahead. I'll tell them you're funding a ferry ticket with their stolen belongings.

BarracksGuard_003_66.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_66.text: How do you know about that? Did those crooks down the docks send you?

BarracksGuard_003_75.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_75.text: I told them I'll get the money in time. Not my fault they're charging triple. 'Danger money' my arse.

BarracksGuard_003_14.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_14.text: Great idea. They can deal with you. Guards - wake up!

BarracksGuard_003_6.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_6.text: How about I do it? Guards - wake up!

BarracksGuard_003_73.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_73.text: I'm guessing it was your stash I found on the roof, then?

BarracksGuard_003_74.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_74.text: Keep it down! Yes, it's my stash, but it's not - I wasn't - I just needed the gold.
BarracksGuard_003_74.context: NodeContext: Panicked, he's been caught out

BarracksGuard_003_65.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_65.text: I'm looking for the owner of that stash hidden on the roof. Know where I could find them?

BarracksGuard_003_97.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_97.text: You found my stash? Please - don't tell anyone. I just needed some quick gold!

BarracksGuard_003_34.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_34.text: Stash? I - I don't know anything about that. I've been guarding this room the whole time.

BarracksGuard_003_50.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_50.text: You need to leave. Immediately. This is a restricted area. Fists only!

BarracksGuard_003_69.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_69.text: Hand over the lockpick, you thieving little worm.

BarracksGuard_003_80.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_80.text: Okay! But it's not - it isn't like that! I'm not a criminal! I just needed the gold.
BarracksGuard_003_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reynahs hands over the lockpick (unseen)

BarracksGuard_003_37.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_37.text: You've got no business being in here, so just clear off.
BarracksGuard_003_37.context: NodeContext: anxious, trying to sound commanding

BarracksGuard_003_38.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_38.text: Sure. If you want me to tell them you were trying to steal their belongings.

BarracksGuard_003_59.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_59.text: I'm no thief! I - I was going to pay it back. Eventually. I just - I needed the gold.

BarracksGuard_003_11.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_11.text: Who do you think you are? Eh? You can't just - just accuse someone of - of being a thief!

BarracksGuard_003_78.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_78.text: Tell me what you're up to or I'll wake them myself.

BarracksGuard_003_99.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_99.text: Please - that won't be necessary. I - I just needed gold. That's all.

BarracksGuard_003_25.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_25.text: I'm getting out of here, taking a ferry down the coast to get me home.

BarracksGuard_003_72.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_72.text: Those bloody crooks at the docks are charging triple, though. 'Danger money'. It's a joke!
BarracksGuard_003_72.context: NodeContext: Pissed off that they're taking advantage

BarracksGuard_003_29.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_29.text: A thief's a thief. I don't care why you're doing it.

BarracksGuard_003_5.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_5.text: But I have to get away. There's an army coming, trying to kill us all!

BarracksGuard_003_0.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_0.text: No! I mean, I'm just - I quit. Nothing wrong with quitting a job.

BarracksGuard_003_26.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_26.text: My wife said we have to stand and fight and - and I can't! I won't... I'm not made for this.

BarracksGuard_003_68.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_68.text: You seem capable from where I'm standing.

BarracksGuard_003_98.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_98.text: I'm not a soldier. I only joined for the uniform and a warm bed.

BarracksGuard_003_1.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_1.text: They're better off without me. I'm scared. All I want is to go home.

BarracksGuard_003_109.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_109.text: Get a grip. You're a soldier - act like one.

BarracksGuard_003_83.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_83.text: I've heard enough. Guards - I've spotted a thief!

BarracksGuard_003_60.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_60.text: Really? You'll just give it to me?
BarracksGuard_003_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the gold to the gnome (unseen)

BarracksGuard_003_76.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_76.text: Look - hidden up on the roof you'll find all the stuff I stole. You can have it.

BarracksGuard_003_81.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_81.text: Thank you. I'll never forget this. Never.

BarracksGuard_003_53.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_53.text: Hand over everything you stole, and I'll let you live long enough to run.

BarracksGuard_003_56.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_56.text: All right, all right. It's all hidden up on the roof.

BarracksGuard_003_10.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_10.text: I just wanted to be safe. I'm not a coward. I'm not.

BarracksGuard_003_21.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_21.text: Help! Someone's trying to kill me!

BarracksGuard_003_86.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_86.text: They've got a point. These are dangerous times to be travelling.

BarracksGuard_003_79.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_79.text: Not by boat! It's the army marching towards us makes things dangerous.

BarracksGuard_003_3.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_3.text: You haven't heard? An army is coming. They're saying it's unstoppable.

BarracksGuard_003_95.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_95.text: I need gold, too. Give me yours, and this goes no further.

BarracksGuard_003_4.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_4.text: I won't tell anyone. For the right price.

BarracksGuard_003_35.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_35.text: 'Course you are. I can't believe they expect me to die protecting lowlifes like you.

BarracksGuard_003_20.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_20.text: My stash is up on the roof. Just take it. I'll find another way to get the gold.

BarracksGuard_003_89.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_89.text: It's over, all right? Finished. Now get out. This is a restricted area.

BarracksGuard_003_106.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_106.text: You already found my stash. That was all I had!
BarracksGuard_003_106.context: NodeContext: Stash has been mentioned previously, he's outraged the player wants more still

BarracksGuard_003_57.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_57.text: I have to report this. You lot - wake up!

BarracksGuard_003_24.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_24.text: Gods, I hope they haven't put up the prices again.

BarracksGuard_003_30.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_30.text: That ferry's my last chance out of here. Bakshi's got to have something that'll cover the rest of my fare.

BarracksGuard_003_85.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_85.text: What are you doing? Get out of my head!

BarracksGuard_003_41.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_41.text: I can't go yet, I'm waiting on your explanation. Why were you stealing?

BarracksGuard_003_58.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_58.text: It's not fair to rob your colleagues, no matter how expensive the boat is.

BarracksGuard_003_52.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_52.text: Why do you need to leave?

BarracksGuard_003_94.speaker: Player
BarracksGuard_003_94.text: You'll be looked on as a coward for deserting your post.

BarracksGuard_003_31.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_31.text: Go on, get lost. You're not allowed in here.

BarracksGuard_003_49.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_49.text: You'll always have a warm welcome in Cloakwood, stranger. I promise.

BarracksGuard_003_96.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_96.text: This area isn't open for the public. You need to leave.

BarracksGuard_003_108.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_108.text: You shouldn't be in here. This barracks is private.

SouthBridge_EmperorAD_FortressClosed_1.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
SouthBridge_EmperorAD_FortressClosed_1.text: Gortash is to be proclaimed Archduke. His grip on the city tightens.

SouthBridge_EmperorAD_FortressClosed_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
SouthBridge_EmperorAD_FortressClosed_0.text: This complicates matters. He has surrounded him with a circle of steel within the fortress of Wyrm's Rock.

SouthBridge_EmperorAD_FortressClosed_2.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
SouthBridge_EmperorAD_FortressClosed_2.text: Gaining access will not be easy. We must either earn an invitation, or find a route where we can pass unnoticed.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_0.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_0.text: Ravengard's a hero! Elturel would still be stuck in the Hells if it weren't for him.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_3.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_3.text: Have you seen the tieflings at the south gate? Elturel's exiles, cast out by their own city.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_1.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_1.text: Your precious hero 'liberated' them from one hell only to trap them in another.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_10.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_10.text: Shut your mouth. Ravengard is a legend.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_11.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_11.text: Ravengard is a charlatan. Like every last patriar of this wretched city.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_8.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_8.text: Lady Alia says the Absolute's army won't be causing trouble for Gortash - or for us.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_7.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_7.text: I'm not sure I believe her, but does it really matter?

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_9.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_9.text: Meaning that in the games of generals and dukes, we're not even pawns, just dust on the board.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_6.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_6.text: What happens next is out of our hands.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_13.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_13.text: Gortash's got Ravengard on his side. That should tell you something.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_5.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_5.text: What? That every duke's just the same as the last, sticking up for each other as the sky falls around us?

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_12.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_12.text: Gods, it must be exhausting to be so cynical.

AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_2.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
AD_MessHallBodyguards_006_007_2.text: Not as exhausting as all that boot-kissing you've been doing.

PAD_JaheiraCommentGuards_0.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraCommentGuards_0.text: The patriars leave their guard dogs below. They must feel safe around the Steel Watch indeed.
PAD_JaheiraCommentGuards_0.context: NodeContext: Quirked eyebrow - Gortash must have the nobility well and truly fooled if they're willing to leave their personal bodyguards outside the ceremony room.

BarracksGuard_003_AD_0.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_AD_0.text: Why'd you have to lock this so tight, Bakshi?

BarracksGuard_003_AD_1.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_AD_1.text: All this waiting around. I can't take it.

BarracksGuard_003_AD_2.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_AD_2.text: You must have something worth a few coin...

BarracksGuard_003_AD_3.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_AD_3.text: How can they sleep when there's a bloody army coming?

BarracksGuard_003_AD_5.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_AD_5.text: Why'd I sign up for this poxy job?

BarracksGuard_003_AD_6.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_AD_6.text: I should never have left Cloakwood.

FFOfficeGuard_001_0.speaker: Manip Cragbender
FFOfficeGuard_001_0.text: You're a stranger. I don't like strangers.

SouthBridgeGuard_003_2.speaker: Fist Gai
SouthBridgeGuard_003_2.text: You want past? Talk to Elin.

MessHallBodyguard_008_0.speaker: Lord Shattershield's Attendant
MessHallBodyguard_008_0.text: Lord Shattershield says Gortash won't be lettin' outsiders in. Good thinkin', you ask me.

MessHallBodyguard_008_1.speaker: Lord Shattershield's Attendant
MessHallBodyguard_008_1.text: Baldur's-Gate-bred, Baldur's-Gate-raised. I'm the real deal.

AlarmWarning_AD_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_FlamingFistCriers
AlarmWarning_AD_0.text: Where are the others? I'm calling for backup!

MessHallBodyguard_004_0.speaker: Lord Portyr's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_004_0.text: Head up, chest out. Lord Portyr could descend any moment.

MessHallBodyguard_004_1.speaker: Lord Portyr's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_004_1.text: Show some decorum. This is a stately occasion.

SouthBridgeGuard_002_4.speaker: Fist Shah
SouthBridgeGuard_002_4.text: Wyrm's Rock's off-limits. You got a problem, see Elin there.

SouthBridgeTrespassingReaction_0.speaker: Blaze Elin, Fist Shah
SouthBridgeTrespassingReaction_0.text: This area's forbidden. Back off or face my blade.

SouthBridgeTrespassingReaction_1.speaker: Player
SouthBridgeTrespassingReaction_1.text: Indeed? Back to the public area, then.

BarracksInterrogation_18.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_18.text: What in the Nine bloody Hells is going on? Reynash?

BarracksInterrogation_34.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_34.text: You've got one breath to explain why you're in here, or you're going straight to the cells.
BarracksInterrogation_34.context: NodeContext: Tired, in a foul mood

BarracksInterrogation_8.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_8.text: I'm a new recruit, just getting the lay of the fortress.

BarracksInterrogation_32.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_32.text: And you thought your first job was to go back to bed?

BarracksInterrogation_21.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_21.text: Get back out there and report to someone on duty! That's an order!

BarracksInterrogation_7.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_7.text: March yourself out of the room.

BarracksInterrogation_15.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_15.text: I saw one of your officers acting suspiciously near that chest.

BarracksInterrogation_19.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_19.text: I just caught another Fist trying to steal from you.

BarracksInterrogation_6.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_6.text: That's impossible. Reynash was on duty the whole -
BarracksInterrogation_6.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, stops short (about to say "night and day" when he realises

BarracksInterrogation_35.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_35.text: That sneaky little git. It was him all along?

BarracksInterrogation_3.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_3.text: How embarrassing. Isn't it your job to catch criminals?

BarracksInterrogation_25.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_25.text: We're preparing for an invasion. You think we have time to go after petty thieves?

BarracksInterrogation_31.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_31.text: Now unless you want me pinning this on you - get out!

BarracksInterrogation_12.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_12.text: The thefts have been happening for a while?

BarracksInterrogation_26.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_26.text: Ever since they ordered us to close the gates. He must have a nice little nest egg by now.

BarracksInterrogation_0.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_0.text: Don't be too hard on him. He was scared and missing home.

BarracksInterrogation_2.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_2.text: We can't all run away and bury our heads in a burrow.

BarracksInterrogation_27.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_27.text: If he shows his face again, he's got a bed waiting in the cells.

BarracksInterrogation_20.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_20.text: Appreciate the help you've given, but we need to get our shut-eye before we're back on duty. Civilian area is back the way you came.
BarracksInterrogation_20.context: NodeContext: Firm - he's not going to negotiate on this

BarracksInterrogation_36.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_36.text: Allow him to escort you out.

BarracksInterrogation_28.speaker: Player
BarracksInterrogation_28.text: I think a reward is customary for this kind of tip-off.

BarracksInterrogation_16.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_16.text: How's this? You leave now, and I won't arrest you for being in a restricted area.

BarracksInterrogation_4.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_4.text: Says the one trespassing in our barracks. You're under arrest.
BarracksInterrogation_4.context: NodeContext: Scorn/disbelief - how gullible do you think he is?

BarracksInterrogation_23.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_23.text: Double duties, half rations, now we can't even get a moment of bloody shut-eye.

BarracksInterrogation_1.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksInterrogation_1.text: Those new recruits had better get here soon, or I'll drag them in from the Lower City myself.

FFOfficeGuard_004_0.speaker: Fist Loudstone
FFOfficeGuard_004_0.text: 'Archduke', 'king', it's all the same. It's always some rich prick in charge.

FFOfficeGuard_004_1.speaker: Fist Loudstone
FFOfficeGuard_004_1.text: Don't care who pays my wage, long as it gets paid.

FFOfficeGuard_004_2.speaker: Fist Loudstone
FFOfficeGuard_004_2.text: They say Gortash won't be king. But that pomp upstairs sure sounds like a coronation.

FFOfficeGuard_004_3.speaker: Fist Loudstone
FFOfficeGuard_004_3.text: Noble crowd, fancy dress. It's just theatre to them.

AudienceHallGuard_001_1.speaker: Fist Kyberos
AudienceHallGuard_001_1.text: The Steel Watch has fallen - I must be vigilant.

AudienceHallGuard_001_3.speaker: Fist Kyberos
AudienceHallGuard_001_3.text: Hail the Archduke. His safety is my duty.

AudienceHallGuard_001_5.speaker: Fist Kyberos
AudienceHallGuard_001_5.text: Traitors got Lord Gortash! Got to stay alert.

BarracksGuard_004_0.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksGuard_004_0.text: Didn't I make myself clear? Get out. Now.

BarracksGuard_004_1.speaker: Manip Bakshi
BarracksGuard_004_1.text: You want a bed for the night, find an inn. Unless you'd prefer a nice long rest in the cells.

FFOfficeGuard_003_0.speaker: Fist Callaway
FFOfficeGuard_003_0.text: The Flaming Fist don't stand for trouble. So stay out of it, yeah?
FFOfficeGuard_003_0.context: NodeContext: delivered like a gentle warning from a neighbourhood policeman

MessHallBodyguard_006_1.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_006_1.text: You hear? M'lady says Absolute's army's on the march. Those Watchers will hold the line, you best believe.

MessHallBodyguard_006_2.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_006_2.text: Every last Watcher's shut down - or so I hear. I'm sure Gortash's got it all under control.

MessHallBodyguard_006_3.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_006_3.text: The dukes are all in on the Watch. I'm not worried - they know what they're doing.

MessHallBodyguard_006_4.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_006_4.text: Did you hear, kin? Every last Steel Watcher's shut down - but I'm sure Gortash's got it all under control.

MessHallBodyguard_006_5.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_006_5.text: Did you hear, kin? The Absolute is on the march, but don't you worry.

MessHallBodyguard_006_0.speaker: Lady Oberon's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_006_0.text: M'lady assures me the Steel Watch will hold the line. There'll be nary a scratch on our scales.

MessHallGuard_001_0.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallGuard_001_0.text: You're free to explore - within reason.

MessHallGuard_001_1.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallGuard_001_1.text: Watch yourself. With Lord Gortash dead, we're tightening security.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_2.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_2.text: Look, I'm all for Gortash, but those clankers? They don't sit right with me.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_9.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_9.text: Because they do your job better than you, and without complaining? It is unnerving.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_1.speaker: Lord Shattershield's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_1.text: Imagine where we'd be without them - the city would be overrun. They're all that's keeping this cult at bay.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_8.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_8.text: He has a point. They make people feel safe, if nothing else.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_25.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_25.text: Ha! You hear this? Tell my friends how safe you feel with those metal giant stamping about.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_6.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_6.text: I couldn't feel safer! Have you seen how big they are?

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_3.speaker: Lord Shattershield's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_3.text: They're a true miracle of engineering.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_14.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_14.text: Hah. It'll be a miracle if they're still working in a tenday.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_11.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_11.text: You shouldn't trust them. They'll turn on all of you eventually.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_17.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_17.text: You've been reading too many picture books.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_7.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_7.text: Lord Gortash himself is the one pulling their strings. We are all better off for it.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_0.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_0.text: I've seen the Absolute's army. No where's safe - Steel Watch or not.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_13.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_13.text: All right, no need to kill the mood.
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_13.context: NodeContext: Asked player a joking question, got a dark, serious answer

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_12.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_12.text: Gods Nop, you sure can pick them.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_21.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_21.text: Safer than with some. No Steel Watcher ever spat at me for how I look.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_5.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_5.text: All right, calm down. Just making conversation.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_24.speaker: Lord Shattershield's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_24.text: Don't let them get to you, Nop. All kinds of funny folk in the city right now.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_23.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_23.text: At least they're chatty. I hear Waterdeep's walking statues are a real bore.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_19.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_19.text: Hear that, Nop? Lord Gortash has them talking. A credit to our city's ingenuity.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_15.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_15.text: They're disgusting. Beings of steel and smoke - nothing natural about them.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_22.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_22.text: They're just tools, like any other weapon.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_10.speaker: Player
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_10.text: They're a blunt tool. For more subtle quarry they'd be useless.

MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_16.speaker: Lord Amber's Bodyguard
MessHallSteelWatchersDiscussion_16.text: They say Lord Gortash is dead. I hope that means those big rustbuckets are on their way out too.

AudienceHallGuard_002_0.speaker: Fist Bella
AudienceHallGuard_002_0.text: A proud day for the Flaming Fist - and for all of Baldur's Gate.

AudienceHallGuard_002_1.speaker: Fist Bella
AudienceHallGuard_002_1.text: Be mindful. The Steel Watchers are disabled.

AudienceHallGuard_002_2.speaker: Fist Bella
AudienceHallGuard_002_2.text: Lord Gortash is dead, but I've done my duty - no one can blame me for it.

AudienceHallGuard_002_3.speaker: Fist Bella
AudienceHallGuard_002_3.text: My loyalty lies with Gortash. He is Baldur's Gate.

AudienceHallGuard_002_4.speaker: Fist Bella
AudienceHallGuard_002_4.text: Ravengard has spoken. Long live Archduke Gortash!

AudienceHallGuard_002_5.speaker: Fist Bella
AudienceHallGuard_002_5.text: Keep your voice down. The ceremony is about to begin.

AudienceHallGuard_003_0.speaker: Fist Earthdigger
AudienceHallGuard_003_0.text: 'Archduke Gortash'. I like the sound of that.

AudienceHallGuard_003_1.speaker: Fist Earthdigger
AudienceHallGuard_003_1.text: An Archduke of Baldur's Gate. Never thought I'd live to see the day.

AudienceHallGuard_003_2.speaker: Fist Earthdigger
AudienceHallGuard_003_2.text: Steel Watch will be up and running in no time. Gortash'll see to that.

AudienceHallGuard_003_3.speaker: Fist Earthdigger
AudienceHallGuard_003_3.text: Lord Gortash may be dead, but his legacy lives on in the Steel Watch. They'll keep on going without him, right?

AudienceHallGuard_003_4.speaker: Fist Earthdigger
AudienceHallGuard_003_4.text: Absolute's army won't stand a chance. Gortash'll crush 'em like roaches under his boot.

AudienceHallGuard_003_5.speaker: Fist Earthdigger
AudienceHallGuard_003_5.text: See Gortash there? That's a leader, that is.

SouthBridge_PAD_WyllComment_0.speaker: Wyll
SouthBridge_PAD_WyllComment_0.text: I'll be - my old fishing spot. Spent more than a few Summertide days here.

SouthBridge_PAD_WyllComment_2.speaker: Player
SouthBridge_PAD_WyllComment_2.text: And did young Wyll ever catch anything?

SouthBridge_PAD_WyllComment_1.speaker: Wyll
SouthBridge_PAD_WyllComment_1.text: Only a few head colds - and a tongue-lashing from my worried father.

RoofAccess_4.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_4.text: Back away, citizen. This is an order.

RoofAccess_0.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_0.text: In that case, you are most welcome. Lord Gortash will want to see you immediately.

RoofAccess_28.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_28.text: Your tongue says one thing, your mind says the opposite. You lie.

RoofAccess_24.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_24.text: Do not test Lord Gortash's patience. Return with the Netherstone.

RoofAccess_23.speaker: Player
RoofAccess_23.text: Assassination. Orin sent me to kill Gortash.

RoofAccess_10.speaker: Player
RoofAccess_10.text: I have a report from the Steel Watch Foundry.

RoofAccess_19.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_19.text: Lord Gortash does not have time for this. File your report through the ordinary channels.

RoofAccess_25.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_25.text: Then I presume it is also insignificant. Good day.

RoofAccess_2.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_2.text: You were not asked to find her. You were asked to kill her.

RoofAccess_7.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_7.text: Lord Gortash will be informed - if you were to kill her and bring her Netherstone, he would be most pleased to reacquaint himself with you.

RoofAccess_26.speaker: Player
RoofAccess_26.text: I'm here on behalf of Orin the Red - Gortash dies today.

RoofAccess_29.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_29.text: You have chosen non-compliance. Your next of kin will be notified of your offence and elimination.

RoofAccess_5.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_5.text: Citizen Fluffington, I advise caution. This area is restricted, under orders of Lord Enver Gortash.

RoofAccess_11.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_11.text: This area is restricted, under orders of Lord Enver Gortash. Intruders are subject to deadly force.

RoofAccess_27.speaker: Steel Watcher
RoofAccess_27.text: You test Lord Gortash's patience. Return with Orin's Netherstone, or do not return at all.

AD_Quartermaster_0.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_0.text: Could've hired two dozen more Fist for the cost of that thing.

AD_Quartermaster_1.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_1.text: Those oversized steel toys are done for, but the Fist are still standing. Maybe now folks will see what we're worth.

AD_Quartermaster_2.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_2.text: I don't care how many they make. Machines won't ever replace the Fist.

AD_Quartermaster_3.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_3.text: Hunk of junk, stomping around. Who needs 'em when you've got Flaming Fist?

AD_Quartermaster_4.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_4.text: The people used to respect the Fist. Now they call for the Steel Watch. Hmph.

AD_Quartermaster_5.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_5.text: I said it a thousand times - those Watchers would fail. Can't say I'm glad to be right.

AD_Quartermaster_6.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_6.text: So much for the Steel Watch. Can't trust a machine to do a Flaming Fist's job.

AD_Quartermaster_7.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
AD_Quartermaster_7.text: Disabled - and all at once, too. Trash for the heap, always were.

PAD_AfterInvitation_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterInvitation_0.text: A personal invitation from Gortash. We shouldn't have any more trouble from the guards.
PAD_AfterInvitation_0.context:
InternalNodeContext: Player convinced the guards to let them in.NodeContext: Karlach: This is about Gortash, so dripping with sarcasm and bitterness and hatred
Minsc: Misunderstanding that the watcher speaking to us with Gortash's voice is not actually Gortash, he hasn't met him.
Jaheira: dry, deadpan.

PAD_AfterInvitation_1.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterInvitation_1.text: We went through all that trouble to get inside, and now Gortash invites us to see him?
PAD_AfterInvitation_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Player entered the fortress without convincing the guards (teleportation, prison etc)NodeContext: Karlach: This is about Gortash, so simmering with emotion

RoofGuard_001_0.speaker: Fist Diallo
RoofGuard_001_0.text: I don't like trouble - so don't go causing any.

RoofGuard_001_1.speaker: Fist Diallo
RoofGuard_001_1.text: You're being watched. Remember that before you do something foolish.

BarracksGuard_003_AD_RunsAway_0.speaker: Fist Reynash
BarracksGuard_003_AD_RunsAway_0.text: Why'd you have to stick your nose in?!

MessHallBodyguard_007_0.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_007_0.text: Cult army on the march, killer on the loose. And Mistress Durinbold still drags me hither and thither.

MessHallBodyguard_007_1.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_007_1.text: Gortash, Ravengard, Portyr. They're the same, if you ask me. Not that I'd tell Lady Alia.

MessHallWaiter_0.speaker: Waiter Jaymes
MessHallWaiter_0.text: I needed the breather. Looks like you need one, too.
MessHallWaiter_0.context: NodeContext: Relaxing after being run ragged

MessHallWaiter_1.speaker: Waiter Jaymes
MessHallWaiter_1.text: Damn dukes kept me running - my feet are beat.
MessHallWaiter_1.context: NodeContext: Relaxing after being run ragged

MessHallWaiter_3.speaker: Waiter Jaymes
MessHallWaiter_3.text: Sorry, sorry, these dukes are working me to the bone.

SteelWatcherInvitation_9.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
SteelWatcherInvitation_9.text: Lord Gortash has been expecting your arrival. Please hold a moment.

SteelWatcherInvitation_2.speaker: Narrator
SteelWatcherInvitation_2.text: *The Watcher's presence fades, but another takes its place. Confident, dominant, commanding.*

SteelWatcherInvitation_0.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_0.text: Greetings, old friend. Orin told me you were on your way here, but I scarcely believed it.
SteelWatcherInvitation_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: warm

SteelWatcherInvitation_10.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_10.text: Welcome back to Baldur's Gate - welcome home.
SteelWatcherInvitation_10.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: warm

SteelWatcherInvitation_21.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_21.text: My most esteemed guest, we meet at last. I am Lord Enver Gortash. You are the Prism-bearer, slayer of the dread General Ketheric Thorm.
SteelWatcherInvitation_21.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: Polite, formal, smug

SteelWatcherInvitation_8.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_8.text: I welcome you to Baldur's Gate. My city.
SteelWatcherInvitation_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: a warm welcome, with an edge of warning on 'my city'. As in, this place is mine, don't step out of line.

SteelWatcherInvitation_20.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_20.text: By the Black Hand - I'd recognise that voice anywhere. Karlach! It's been an eternity.
SteelWatcherInvitation_20.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: surprised and seemingly delighted

SteelWatcherInvitation_18.speaker: Player
SteelWatcherInvitation_18.text: This city will never be yours.

SteelWatcherInvitation_16.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_16.text: It already is. Granted, there are a few formalities to complete, but... well, why don't you come and see?
SteelWatcherInvitation_16.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: smug

SteelWatcherInvitation_5.speaker: Player
SteelWatcherInvitation_5.text: A pleasure to meet you. Could we talk face-to-face?

SteelWatcherInvitation_14.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_14.text: Of course, of course. My Steel Watchers are rather adept at keeping the peace, but not entirely suitable for polite conversation.
SteelWatcherInvitation_14.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: apologetic, but still extremely pleased with himself and the virtues of his 'steel watch'.

SteelWatcherInvitation_15.speaker: Player
SteelWatcherInvitation_15.text: I'm going to find you, and I'm going to kill you.

SteelWatcherInvitation_4.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_4.text: I admire your audacity... but it'll be the death of you. Ketheric had an army of corpses and a crumbling tower. I have a city and an army of steel.
SteelWatcherInvitation_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: genuine on first phrase, but the threat/warning on the latter phrase is much more serious than any admiration

SteelWatcherInvitation_3.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_3.text: It would be better for us both to resolve our differences amicably, and I have the perfect venue for a face-to-face meeting.
SteelWatcherInvitation_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: reasonable

SteelWatcherInvitation_1.speaker: Steel Watcher
SteelWatcherInvitation_1.text: Allow me to formally invite you to my inauguration. Make your way to the ceremonial hall.
SteelWatcherInvitation_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Voice only, no mocap. Voice coming from Steel Watcher.NodeContext: smug, but the invitation is genuine. This is no trap.

SteelWatcherInvitation_11.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
SteelWatcherInvitation_11.text: Halt. We do not know how you gained entry, but your trespass shall not be punished. Lord Gortash has been expecting you.

SteelWatcherInvitation_13.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
SteelWatcherInvitation_13.text: Gortash requests your presence in the audience hall, citizen. Do not keep him waiting.

MessHallBodyguard_009_0.speaker: Lord Portyr's Attendant
MessHallBodyguard_009_0.text: Master Portyr, I've taken the liberty of... oh, you are not the master. Just as well.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_1.speaker: Fist Shah
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_1.text: They just keep coming. Send them to Amn, make them Athkatla's problem.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_6.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_6.text: From the mouth of a shark and into its belly.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_3.speaker: Fist Shah
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_3.text: Have you got a problem with that?

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_2.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_2.text: Hells no. They'll be devoured one way or another.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_0.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_0.text: Better that Athkatla be the ones to clean up the remains.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_5.speaker: Fist Shah
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_5.text: Lord Gortash is dead! Why are we still standing guard here like nothing's happened?

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_11.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_11.text: Your orders haven't changed, and until they do, nothing has happened.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_13.speaker: Fist Shah
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_13.text: And you think that makes sense?

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_7.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_7.text: I do, but then I'm paid to think. You aren't. Shut up, hold your weapon straight, and keep your eyes open.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_12.speaker: Fist Shah
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_12.text: What a mess. The damn gate's all but overrun.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_10.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_10.text: You've got your orders. Citizens only.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_8.speaker: Fist Gai
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_8.text: Can't keep an eye on all of them. Someone's bound to slip past.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_14.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_14.text: Not on my watch they're not.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_16.speaker: Fist Gai
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_16.text: That cult army shows up, and exiles are the least of our problems.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_9.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_9.text: Gortash's forces will crush the cultists before we see the gleams of their helms.

AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_4.speaker: Blaze Elin
AD_SouthBridgeGroupDialog_4.text: Then I expect you to fight to the last in defence of the city.

BarracksGuard_002_1.speaker: Fist Debin
BarracksGuard_002_1.text: Don't you speak the common tongue? I said PISS OFF. Moron.

BarracksGuard_002_2.speaker: Fist Debin
BarracksGuard_002_2.text: Reynash, huh. Glad the toe-rag's buggered off. I'd do the same if I were you. Go on, piss off.

MessHallStairs_10.speaker: Narrator
MessHallStairs_10.text: *The Watcher penetrates your mind. The parasite wrenches in pain, and your skull along with it.*
MessHallStairs_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: One shot just for this node showing player touch their head.

MessHallStairs_0.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
MessHallStairs_0.text: Your presence here is unauthorised, citizen Fluffington.
MessHallStairs_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The machine gears up to attack. (Not sure how the watchers might look or sound for this at the moment.)

MessHallStairs_6.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallStairs_6.context: NodeContext: Interrupted at end of sentence

MessHallStairs_7.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
MessHallStairs_7.text: G - G - G - (erratum emendo) You are welcome to pass, citizen. Lord Gortash looks forward to making your acquaintance.

MessHallStairs_4.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallStairs_4.text: That's a first. Usually when they go like this, someone ends up dead.

MessHallStairs_8.speaker: Player
MessHallStairs_8.text: What's going on up there, exactly?

MessHallStairs_9.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallStairs_9.text: The Council's naming Lord Gortash as Archduke.

MessHallStairs_11.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallStairs_11.text: Stand-up fellow. He'll clean up the city in no time. Got more backbone in his little finger than Ravengard has in his entire body.

MessHallStairs_1.speaker: Player
MessHallStairs_1.text: I don't understand. Why did the Watcher change its mind?

MessHallStairs_5.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallStairs_5.text: Above my pay grade. In case you hadn't noticed, I'm guarding a staircase.

MessHallStairs_3.speaker: Fist Dresten
MessHallStairs_3.text: But it seems you're expected. Up the stairs, straight ahead. You can't miss it.

MessHallStairs_12.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
MessHallStairs_12.text: Your presence here is unauthorised, citizen.
MessHallStairs_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The machine gears up to attack. (Not sure how the watchers might look or sound for this at the moment.)

MessHallBodyguard_001_0.speaker: Lord Shattershield's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_001_0.text: Lord, archduke, god - I'll call Gortash what he wants, long as Lord Shattershield pays me for all this waiting around.

MessHallBodyguard_001_1.speaker: Lord Shattershield's Bodyguard
MessHallBodyguard_001_1.text: Keep your nose clean, yeah? I might be small - but I've got bite.

MessHallBodyguard_003_0.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallBodyguard_003_0.text: My Lady says cult army's got no chance - not with the Steel Watch at the ready.

MessHallBodyguard_003_1.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallBodyguard_003_1.text: Lady Alia says 'jump', and I jump. That's the way of things.

MessHallBodyguard_003_2.speaker: Lady Durinbold's Attendant
MessHallBodyguard_003_2.text: Cult army's coming, my Lady says. No way they'll get past the Fist.

BarracksGuard_001_0.speaker: Fist Oriona
BarracksGuard_001_0.text: Ungh. Whatever it is, speak to Bakshi and let me get some bloody sleep.

BarracksGuard_001_1.speaker: Fist Oriona
BarracksGuard_001_1.text: So you caught Reynash in the act? As useless a criminal as he was a Fist. Not that I'm surprised.

BarracksGuard_001_2.speaker: Fist Oriona
BarracksGuard_001_2.text: Leave me be. Do you know how hard it is to get some shut-eye in this place?

AudienceHallGuard_005_0.speaker: Fist Klaas
AudienceHallGuard_005_0.text: Silence. I don't want to miss a single word.

AudienceHallGuard_005_1.speaker: Fist Klaas
AudienceHallGuard_005_1.text: Hail Archduke Gortash, guardian of Baldur's Gate!

AudienceHallGuard_005_2.speaker: Fist Klaas
AudienceHallGuard_005_2.text: A city is only as mighty as its leader. Under Gortash, no army can breach our walls!

AudienceHallGuard_005_3.speaker: Fist Klaas
AudienceHallGuard_005_3.text: With Lord Gortash dead, they have to announce who the new commander is, and soon. We need a strong hand at the tiller.

Quartermaster_26.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_26.text: This is the armoury, not a bloody open house. Fists only. Now clear off.

Quartermaster_3.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_3.text: I'd like to trade with you.

Quartermaster_5.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_5.text: Trade? Do I look like a shopkeeper?

Quartermaster_4.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_4.text: This equipment isn't for sale. It belongs to the Flaming Fist.
Quartermaster_4.context: NodeContext: 'for now, anyway' has bitter edge to it

Quartermaster_1.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_1.text: Steel Watchers make me uneasy. A good weapon in my palm would put my mind at rest.

Quartermaster_23.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_23.text: Huh. Wouldn't think anything round here would bother the likes of you. But you're not wrong.
Quartermaster_23.context: NodeContext: 'Huh' is appraising, she's surprised but ultimately believes you

Quartermaster_9.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_9.text: Strong folk wielding strong blades. That's what keeps folk safe. Not those glorified golems.
Quartermaster_9.context: NodeContext: Empassioned, but not too loud, in case anyone hears

Quartermaster_8.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_8.text: I don't have anything fancy, but you're welcome to take a look.

Quartermaster_32.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_32.text: Lord Gortash himself told me to speak with you about my requirements. Were you not informed?

Quartermaster_47.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_47.text: 'Course I bloody wasn't. Too busy ordering more of these mechanical monstrosities to tell me.

Quartermaster_22.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_22.text: I suppose you can take a look. But make it quick.

Quartermaster_77.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_77.text: Stay sharp, stranger. In these times, all we can trust are the blades in our hands.

Quartermaster_68.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_68.text: No, I wasn't. And if he thinks he can sell off my armoury without telling me... narg mragreshem.
Quartermaster_68.context: NodeContext: Pissed off. Narg mragreshem (NARG mrag-RESH-em) = big shithead.

Quartermaster_15.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_15.text: You want to spend your gold, find a merchant in the city. My weapons are not for sale!

Quartermaster_65.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_65.text: Either you trade with me, or I suggest you start running.

Quartermaster_13.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_13.text: Fat lot of use that hunk of junk was. Keeping me 'safe', were you? Useless.
Quartermaster_13.context: NodeContext: partially to self, re steel watcher in the armoury, 'keeping me safe' is sarcastic.

Quartermaster_64.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_64.text: Hrm. Guess anyone can saunter in and make threats now that the Watchers are disabled.

Quartermaster_12.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_12.text: Wake up, you useless hunk of junk, I'm being attacked!
Quartermaster_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shouting to the steel watcherNodeContext: Panicked

Quartermaster_31.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_31.text: What if I were to pay for, say, a 'trading licence' first?

Quartermaster_42.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_42.text: A trading licence? Right, right. Yes, I could provide you with one of those, for the, uh, official fee. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Quartermaster_42.context: NodeContext: Slow to catch on, then playing along

Quartermaster_62.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_62.text: Much appreciated. Take a look around.

Quartermaster_19.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_19.text: Pleasure doing business with you. Now bugger off.

Quartermaster_0.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_0.text: Good. Clear off, then. I'm busy.
Quartermaster_0.context: NodeContext: A bit flustered,she almost accepted a bribe and now wants the conversation done

Quartermaster_76.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_76.text: Shhh. Quiet! That rust heap might be listening...
Quartermaster_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: flinching, scaredNodeContext: quieter, trying not to be overheard (not whispered)

Quartermaster_46.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_46.text: Shhh. Quiet! Someone might be listening...

Quartermaster_73.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_73.text: I'm not interested. Now get out. I've got work to do.

Quartermaster_20.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_20.text: Seek the cause of her sour mood.

Quartermaster_11.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_11.text: Can't believe they put that mindless metal mragreshem in my armoury.

Quartermaster_60.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_60.text: 'Steel Watchers'. Stupid thing'll probably decapitate me for cleaning the bloody mace rack.

Quartermaster_35.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_35.text: Won't be long before those Watchers are hulking around here again, nosin' in on my affairs.

Quartermaster_49.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_49.text: Wake up, you brainless gimcrack! I'm being attacked!
Quartermaster_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shouting to the steel watcherNodeContext: Panicked

Quartermaster_40.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_40.text: Dammit, someone help me - this fool's messing in my mind!

Quartermaster_63.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_63.text: The better outfitted I am, the less work there is for you Fists inside the city.

Quartermaster_36.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_36.text: A gith in my armoury? I don't think so. Clear off.

Quartermaster_16.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_16.text: Show me what you have to trade, istik.
Quartermaster_16.context: NodeContext: Istik (ISS-tik) = stranger (catch-all term for non-gith)

Quartermaster_51.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_51.text: Oi. I told you already - Flaming Fists only in here. Leave. Now.

Quartermaster_33.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_33.text: Just checking if that trading licence is still available?

Quartermaster_57.speaker: Arkleia Oloril
Quartermaster_57.text: It is, but the er... fee isn't negotiable. Come back when you have the coin.
Quartermaster_57.context: NodeContext: a bit awkward, the 'fee' is a bribe

Quartermaster_25.speaker: Player
Quartermaster_25.text: I'd like to buy the trading licence we discussed. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

MessHallCook_1.speaker: Cook Darlie
MessHallCook_1.text: Broth's bubbling - no time to talk!

MessHallCook_2.speaker: Cook Darlie
MessHallCook_2.text: Rest your bones. I'm damn sure resting mine.

MessHallCook_3.speaker: Cook Darlie
MessHallCook_3.text: The dukes beat feet, thank the Provider.
